title: 35.5 The Subset-Sum Problem
content:
Section 35.5

The Subset-Sum Problem

Summary

Fully polynomial-time approximation scheme (FPTAS).

Key Points

  • Subset sum: is there subset summing to exactly t?
  • Optimization: find subset sum ≤ t maximizing sum
  • FPTAS: (1-ε)-approximation in O(n²/ε) time
  • Trimming: keep only values sufficiently different
  • Polynomial in both n and 1/ε

Example

ε = 0.1: group sums differing by ≤ 10% into equivalence classes. Process in polynomial time.

Why It Matters

Shows some NP-hard problems admit arbitrarily good approximations.
